description.narrative: AVSI has an established presence in Lamwo District, strong relationships with main stakeholders and its technical expertise make the organization well positioned to scale up the interventions and offer additional services to the youth, filling gaps of access to psychosocial support and education services. Overall Goal and Outcome # Overall goal is to contribute #to Save lives, rebuild livelihoods, protect human dignity and enhance resilience of South Sudan refugees and their host communities in PalabekSettlements, Lamwo District, Northern Uganda. # AVSI Uganda will ensure that Quality, sustainable and resilient educational opportunities availed to refugee and host community children in Palabek, Lamwo; and particularly work to ensure improved learningand retention of ALP learners and educators. AVSI will support the construction of teachers accommodation; expand on ALP learners facilities and enhance quality through supervision and monitoring.

participating-org.narrative: AVSI is an international non-profit organization founded in Italy with long- term development and emergency relief projects in 30 countries around the world. AVSI has been operating in Uganda since 1984 starting in the Northern Uganda region intervening during the LRA conflict and quickly expanding to at least 70 districts in all regions with national headquarters in Kampala and 13 field offices (including within the proposed project site # Palabek). AVSI#s sectors of operation in Uganda include health, food security and nutrition, agriculture, disability, education including early childhood care and development, protection including child protection and psychosocial support programs, economic recovery and livelihoods, water and sanitation, environment and energy. Now, AVSI has a running Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Uganda Office of the Prime Minister for refugee interventions in Palabek (Lamwo District), Rhino (Arua District) and Rwamwanja (Kamwenge district) and Kyangwali (Kikuube District) refugee settlements, implementingemergency programs funded by UNHCR, UNICEF, EU, DFID and the Italian Government. AVSI has a signed memorandum of understanding witheach of the 70 district local governments where AVSI operates in addition to a national level memorandum with the office of the prime minster. AVSI also works through over 100 local partners and it is an active member of various working groups (such as Education in Emergency, Child Protection, and Mental Health). AVSI has been active in the humanitarian response in Palabek from the very beginning of the emergency, being an established partner of District Local Government in the area. In 2017 AVSI received funds from UNHCRand became the lead agency for the delivery of Education and Protection services within Palabek Refugees Settlement.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
